page.title: 20Local Issues
page.content: The main concern of people in this rural area is the diminishing level of services.In the past decade two local schools have closed,a post office and shop have disappeared and public transport has almost ceased to exist. The increase in traffic is another worry. A 40mph speed limit has been recently introduced in Kimbolton following local pressure and a footpath for the schoolchildren has been partially completed after much concern over the danger of walking alongside the main road. Residents of Leysters have protested about a proposal to create slurry pits for storage of waste matter from a local factory prior to its distribution on fields.These and other issues reflect a growing awareness of the need to improve the quality of life.
